title: What's the best interpretation of the song 'Hotel California' and is there a correct one? - Quora

response.answer_text: The best interpretation of Hotel California is that it is about Satanism. Some people say that Church of Satan leader Anton LaVey appears in a window on the cover. The line “…they stab it with their steely knives, but they just can’t kill the beast” could refer to an animal sacrifice. Finally, the Eagles' manager, Larry Salter, allegedly admitted in the Waco Tribune-Herald (Feb. 28, 1982) that the Eagles were involved with the Church of Satan.

It's the most famous song from the Eagles. Isn't it? I love the song  and it carries a very complex meaning mostly referring to the ill effects of the American Dream, With all this money and success the Eagles soon found that they had become "prisoners of their own device."If you really want to dig deep and want to understand the meaning of the lyrics, You can check on this  :Hotel California Meaning Apt. Explanation. Source: Hotel California Meaning
